AMQP Messaging Demo for JavaScript

Try the demo

This demo shows some of the core client features of AMQP, and lets you publish and consume AMQP messages.

For information on how to build a JavaScript client, see Checklist: How to Build JavaScript Clients Using Kaazing WebSocket Gateway. You can learn about the advanced features of AMQP by following the Real-Time Interactive Guide to AMQP.

Connecting

Set the Location to the URL of the KAAZING Gateway service. For example: ws://localhost:8001/amqp.

The AMQP Username and AMQP Password must exist for a user on the AMQP broker. The Virtual Host must also exist on the AMQP broker, and the user must have privileges to access it. If you're not sure what the virtual host is, the root virtual host is usually /.

In a demo, prototype, or development environment, it's okay to let the client specify the virtual host. In a production environment, the virtual host should be specified in a trusted way on the server side, in KAAZING Gateway. Refer to the service property virtual.host for more information.
